channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 7 Data Points That Show How Consumer Sentiment is Shifting
item.description: Sixty-five percent of Americans think we’re currently in a recession. They’re wrong.

item.title: Tesla sales cratered in California for 7 straight quarters while rivals Toyota and Honda surge, report shows
item.description: The once-unstoppable electric-vehicle maker saw new car and truck registrations tumble 18.3% compared to the first half of last year, according to Exp...

item.title: Coke will pit two versions of its key product against each other. Is that wise?
Exclusive: Mark Cuban says AI will be a baseline skill like email or Excel in 5 years and entrepreneurs should embrace it or get left behind
item.description: The billionaire investor told Fortune new AI assistants available to entrepreneurs will help turn “solo founders into full teams.”

item.title: GM’s $1.1 billion tariff hit bolsters mounting evidence that Americans are the ones footing the bill for Trump’s import taxes
item.description: “The top-down macroevidence seems clear: Americans are mostly paying for the tariffs,” a Deutsche Bank analyst said in a note published Tuesday.

item.title: Eventual, a climate fintech, raises $7.5 million seed round from AlleyCorp and Upfront Ventures
item.description: Eventual’s AI model predicts how insurance prices will evolve for any given U.S. property as far ahead as five years in the future.

item.title: Halliburton CEO: Oil and gas markets are “softer” than expected and will remain weak for all of 2025
item.description: The oil sector braces for a bearish back half of 2025 while remaining optimistic for the long run.

item.title: There’s a way to design better, together

item.title: Looming Over Two Court Cases Is a Single Question: Can Elon Musk Be Trusted?
item.description: Both court cases relate to Elon Musk’s car company, Tesla, and its Autopilot technology.

item.title: Replit CEO: What really happened when AI agent wiped Jason Lemkin’s database (exclusive)

item.title: Skims Expands Its Sports Reach Thanks to a Partnership With This $160-Million League
item.description: The women’s volleyball league LOVB has attracted the attention of Kim Kardashian’s $4-billion shapewear brand.

item.title: Workplace Injuries Cost Nearly $60 Billion a Year. Here’s What Small Business Owners Need to Know
item.description: Injuries at work can hurt your bottom line, but reviewing your company’s safety measures can make them less frequent.
